clusters.title: Mass shooting at South African hostel bar leaves 11 dead, including 3 children
clusters.neutral_headline: South African Bar Shooting Leaves Many Dead

items.title: Mass shooting at South African hostel bar leaves 11 dead, including 3 children
items.standfirst: A mass shooting carried out Saturday by multiple suspects in an unlicensed bar near the South African capital left at least 11 people dead, police said. The victims included three children aged 3, 12 and 16.
items.content: A mass shooting carried out Saturday by multiple suspects in an unlicensed bar near the South African capital left at least 11 people dead, police said. The victims included three children aged 3, 12 and 16.

items.title: 11 killed, including 3 children, in shooting at a South African bar
items.standfirst: Over a dozen people were wounded and taken to the hospital, the South African Police Services said in a statement.
items.content: Over a dozen people were wounded and taken to the hospital, the South African Police Services said in a statement.

items.title: Three Children Killed in Mass Shooting at South Africa Bar
items.standfirst: A mass shooting at an unlicensed bar in South Africa early Saturday morning left 11 people dead, including three children, and another 14 people injured, according to local police spokesperson. Police say at least three unidentified gunmen began shooting inside a hostel in Saulsville, outside…
items.content: A mass shooting at an unlicensed bar in South Africa early Saturday morning left 11 people dead, including three children, and another 14 people injured, according to local police spokesperson. Police say at least three unidentified gunmen began shooting inside a hostel in Saulsville, outside…

items.title: South Africa shooting leaves 12 dead, including young child: Police
items.standfirst: Police say 25 people were shot at 'illegal' bar in hostel in Pretoria, with three children among the dead.
items.content: Police say 25 people were shot at 'illegal' bar in hostel in Pretoria, with three children among the dead.

items.title: Gunmen kill at least 11 people including three-year-old in hostel in South Africa
items.standfirst: Police launch ‘manhunt’ after 25 people are shot in early morning in township attack west of PretoriaGunmen have stormed into a hostel in South Africa’s capital and killed at least 11 people, including a three-year-old child, and injured more than a dozen others.Police said they had launched a “manhunt” for three people and were investigating whether the killings were linked to a bar within the hostel that may have been selling alcohol illegally. Continue reading...
items.content: Police launch ‘manhunt’ after 25 people are shot in early morning in township attack west of PretoriaGunmen have stormed into a hostel in South Africa’s capital and killed at least 11 people, including a three-year-old child, and injured more than a dozen others.Police said they had launched a “manhunt” for three people and were investigating whether the killings were linked to a bar within the hostel that may have been selling alcohol illegally. Continue reading...

items.title: Twelve killed in shooting at South African bar, including young children, police say
items.standfirst: At least 12 people have been killed, including a three-year-old boy, in a shooting at an illegal bar in the South African city of Pretoria, police say.
items.content: At least 12 people have been killed, including a three-year-old boy, in a shooting at an illegal bar in the South African city of Pretoria, police say.

items.title: At least 11 killed in South Africa mass shooting
items.standfirst: Gunmen stormed a hostel near Pretoria and opened fire, killing 11 people including a three-year-old.
items.content: Gunmen stormed a hostel near Pretoria and opened fire, killing 11 people including a three-year-old.

ai_summary: A mass shooting at a South African bar left at least eleven people dead, including three children.
The shooting occurred at an unlicensed bar near Pretoria, South Africa, on Saturday morning.
Police reported that over a dozen people were wounded and taken to the hospital for treatment.
Authorities have launched a manhunt for at least three unidentified gunmen involved in the attack.
The bar was reportedly selling alcohol illegally, according to police investigations.

clusters.title: 12/6: Saturday Morning
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Awarded Peace Prize at FIFA World Cup Draw

items.title: 12/6: Saturday Morning
items.standfirst: The U.S. is facing record-low temperatures and severe weather. Meanwhile, President Trump was awarded a peace prize at the FIFA Men's World Cup draw.
items.content: The U.S. is facing record-low temperatures and severe weather. Meanwhile, President Trump was awarded a peace prize at the FIFA Men's World Cup draw.

items.title: Trump finally meets Claudia Sheinbaum face to face at the FIFA World Cup draw
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump has finally met with his Mexican counterpart, Claudia Sheinbaum. Their long-delayed first face-to-face discussion focused on next year’s World Cup — and included side discussions about trade and tariffs — but immigration was not the top issue. That’s despite Trump’s push to…
items.content: President Donald Trump has finally met with his Mexican counterpart, Claudia Sheinbaum. Their long-delayed first face-to-face discussion focused on next year’s World Cup — and included side discussions about trade and tariffs — but immigration was not the top issue. That’s despite Trump’s push to…

items.title: Trump wins peace prize at FIFA Men's World Cup draw
items.standfirst: President Trump, along with Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum and Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney participated in the FIFA Men's World Cup draw on Friday in Washington, D.C. The world soccer organization also awarded Mr. Trump with its inaugural peace prize.
items.content: President Trump, along with Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum and Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney participated in the FIFA Men's World Cup draw on Friday in Washington, D.C. The world soccer organization also awarded Mr. Trump with its inaugural peace prize.

items.title: Eye Opener: Trump, world leaders participate in FIFA Men's World Cup draw
items.standfirst: President Trump and other world leaders participated in the FIFA Men's World Cup draw on Friday. Meanwhile, Catherine, Princess of Wales, hosted her annual Christmas concert. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
items.content: President Trump and other world leaders participated in the FIFA Men's World Cup draw on Friday. Meanwhile, Catherine, Princess of Wales, hosted her annual Christmas concert. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.

items.title: North American leaders take stage together for the first time
items.standfirst: The World Cup draw marked the first time that Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum has met Trump, and the trio briefly discussed trade.
items.content: The World Cup draw marked the first time that Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum has met Trump, and the trio briefly discussed trade.

items.title: Donald Trump awarded FIFA peace prize at World Cup draw
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump has been awarded FIFA's new peace prize at the draw for next year's World Cup.
items.content: US President Donald Trump has been awarded FIFA's new peace prize at the draw for next year's World Cup.

ai_summary: President Trump met with Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum at the FIFA World Cup draw.
The meeting was their first face-to-face discussion and focused on the upcoming World Cup.
FIFA awarded Trump its inaugural peace prize during the World Cup draw event.
Other world leaders, including Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, also attended the draw.
The draw marked the first time North American leaders took the stage together.

clusters.title: Russia Launches Massive Attack on Ukraine Amid Peace Talks
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia Launches Attacks on Ukraine Amid Talks

items.title: Russia Launches Massive Attack on Ukraine Amid Peace Talks
items.standfirst: Russia launched dozens of missiles and hundreds of drones at Ukraine overnight, the Ukrainian Air Force said on Telegram, just hours before officials from the United States and Ukraine were set to meet for a third day of talks aimed at ending the war. Why It Matters Senior Ukrainian officials held…
items.content: Russia launched dozens of missiles and hundreds of drones at Ukraine overnight, the Ukrainian Air Force said on Telegram, just hours before officials from the United States and Ukraine were set to meet for a third day of talks aimed at ending the war. Why It Matters Senior Ukrainian officials held…

items.title: Russia launches attacks across Ukraine as Miami peace talks continue
items.standfirst: More than 650 drones target locations across Ukraine including western regions with sirens sounding in eastern PolandRussia launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine in the early hours of Saturday as US and Ukrainian officials continued talks in Miami which the White House hopes will bring an end to the conflict.Russia used more than 650 drones and 51 missiles overnight, Ukraine’s armed forces said, with drones targeting locations across the country, including in western regions hundreds of miles from the frontline. Warning sirens also sounded in parts of eastern Poland, close to the Ukrainian border. Continue reading...
items.content: More than 650 drones target locations across Ukraine including western regions with sirens sounding in eastern PolandRussia launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine in the early hours of Saturday as US and Ukrainian officials continued talks in Miami which the White House hopes will bring an end to the conflict.Russia used more than 650 drones and 51 missiles overnight, Ukraine’s armed forces said, with drones targeting locations across the country, including in western regions hundreds of miles from the frontline. Warning sirens also sounded in parts of eastern Poland, close to the Ukrainian border. Continue reading...

items.title: Russia targets Ukraine with massive drone attack amid diplomatic talks
items.standfirst: Russia launched a huge attack on Ukraine overnight as the country marked Armed Forces Day on Saturday, Ukraine's air force said.
items.content: Russia launched a huge attack on Ukraine overnight as the country marked Armed Forces Day on Saturday, Ukraine's air force said.

items.title: Russia unleashes drone and missile attack on Ukraine as diplomatic talks continue
items.standfirst: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, after U.S. and Ukrainian officials said they'll meet on Saturday for talks aimed at ending the war.
items.content: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, after U.S. and Ukrainian officials said they'll meet on Saturday for talks aimed at ending the war.(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)

ai_summary: Russia launched a large-scale drone and missile attack on Ukraine overnight Saturday.
The attack occurred just hours before U.S. and Ukrainian officials met for peace talks.
Ukraine's Air Force reported dozens of missiles and hundreds of drones were used in the attack.
The attacks targeted locations across Ukraine, including western regions.
Warning sirens sounded in parts of eastern Poland near the Ukrainian border.

clusters.title: Kallas calls Washington EU's 'biggest ally' after US security strategy slams Europe
clusters.neutral_headline: EU Says US Remains Biggest Ally Despite Strategy

items.title: Kallas calls Washington EU's 'biggest ally' after US security strategy slams Europe
items.standfirst: EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas responded Saturday to a new US National Security Strategy accusing Europe of facing "civilisational erasure" due to its immigration policies by saying that Washington remained the bloc's main ally. The strategy also called for the US to aggressively maintain dominance in the Western Hemisphere.
items.content: EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas responded Saturday to a new US National Security Strategy accusing Europe of facing "civilisational erasure" due to its immigration policies by saying that Washington remained the bloc's main ally. The strategy also called for the US to aggressively maintain dominance in the Western Hemisphere.

items.title: Kaja Kallas says Washington EU's 'biggest ally' after US security strategy published
items.standfirst: European Union foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas said on Saturday that the United States remains Europe's biggest ally, after the Trump administration said in a major strategy document that Europe faces "civilisational erasure" and may one day lose its status as a reliable ally. The new US National Security Strategy, posted on the White House website overnight Thursday-to-Friday, denounced the European Union as anti-democratic and Europe as lacking in self-confidence, and said the goal of the US should be "to help Europe correct its current trajectory". Analysis by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Kethevane Gorjestani.
items.content: European Union foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas said on Saturday that the United States remains Europe's biggest ally, after the Trump administration said in a major strategy document that Europe faces "civilisational erasure" and may one day lose its status as a reliable ally. The new US National Security Strategy, posted on the White House website overnight Thursday-to-Friday, denounced the European Union as anti-democratic and Europe as lacking in self-confidence, and said the goal of the US should be "to help Europe correct its current trajectory". Analysis by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Kethevane Gorjestani.

items.title: EU says US ‘still our biggest ally’ despite release of policy paper supporting Europe’s far-right – as it happened
items.standfirst: This blog is now closed, you can read more of our European news coverage hereOvernight Russian missile and drone strikes left parts of Ukraine without power on Saturday morning, Ukraine’s energy ministry said.The Russian defense ministry confirmed that Russian forces attacked energy facilities that supported the Ukrainian military and port infrastructure used by Ukrainian forces, saying that the strike was in response to what it called Ukrainian attacks on civilian targets.The Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant temporarily lost all off-site power overnight, the International Atomic Energy Agency said on Saturday, marking the 11th time the facility temporarily lost power during the war.Ukraine peace plan talks continue between Trump advisers and Ukrainian officials, with the parties involved saying on Friday that they will meet for a third day of talks.EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas responded to the US National Security Strategy, a policy paper released by the Trump administration on Friday that made explicit Washington’s support for Europe’s nationalist far-right parties. “US is still our biggest ally,” Kallas said Saturday.Keir Starmer is scheduled to meet with Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Downing Street on Monday, the Press Association reports. Continue reading...
items.content: This blog is now closed, you can read more of our European news coverage hereOvernight Russian missile and drone strikes left parts of Ukraine without power on Saturday morning, Ukraine’s energy ministry said.The Russian defense ministry confirmed that Russian forces attacked energy facilities that supported the Ukrainian military and port infrastructure used by Ukrainian forces, saying that the strike was in response to what it called Ukrainian attacks on civilian targets.The Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant temporarily lost all off-site power overnight, the International Atomic Energy Agency said on Saturday, marking the 11th time the facility temporarily lost power during the war.Ukraine peace plan talks continue between Trump advisers and Ukrainian officials, with the parties involved saying on Friday that they will meet for a third day of talks.EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas responded to the US National Security Strategy, a policy paper released by the Trump administration on Friday that made explicit Washington’s support for Europe’s nationalist far-right parties. “US is still our biggest ally,” Kallas said Saturday.Keir Starmer is scheduled to meet with Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Downing Street on Monday, the Press Association reports. Continue reading...

items.title: EU’s Kallas says Washington ‘biggest ally’ despite US security downgrade
items.standfirst: Foreign policy chief keeping Washington onside as Ukrainian, US officials continue talks on ending Russia-Ukraine war.
items.content: Foreign policy chief keeping Washington onside as Ukrainian, US officials continue talks on ending Russia-Ukraine war.

ai_summary: EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas stated the U.S. is still Europe's biggest ally.
This statement followed a new U.S. National Security Strategy criticizing Europe.
The U.S. strategy accused Europe of facing "civilisational erasure" due to immigration.
The strategy also called for the U.S. to maintain dominance in the Western Hemisphere.
Overnight Russian attacks left parts of Ukraine without power on Saturday morning.

clusters.title: Deadly attack on kindergarten reported in Sudan
clusters.neutral_headline: Drone Attack on Sudan Kindergarten Kills Children

items.title: Deadly attack on kindergarten reported in Sudan
items.standfirst: Drone strikes on a town in South Kordofan on Thursday are said to have killed at least 50 people.
items.content: Drone strikes on a town in South Kordofan on Thursday are said to have killed at least 50 people.

items.title: At least 33 children killed in paramilitary drone attack on nursery
items.standfirst: At least 50 people, including 33 children, have been killed in southern Sudan after a drone attack by paramilitary forces hit a nursery in South Kordofan state.
items.content: At least 50 people, including 33 children, have been killed in southern Sudan after a drone attack by paramilitary forces hit a nursery in South Kordofan state.

items.title: Sudanese paramilitary drone attack kills 50, including 33 children, doctor group says
items.standfirst: Thursday's attack is the latest in the fighting between the paramilitary group, the Rapid Support Forces, also known as the RSF, and the Sudanese military, who have been at war for over two years.
items.content: Thursday's attack is the latest in the fighting between the paramilitary group, the Rapid Support Forces, also known as the RSF, and the Sudanese military, who have been at war for over two years.(Image credit: AP)

ai_summary: A drone attack on a nursery in Sudan killed at least 50 people.
The attack occurred in South Kordofan state, targeting a kindergarten.
Thirty-three children were among the fatalities in the drone strike.
The attack was carried out by paramilitary forces, according to reports.
The incident is the latest in the ongoing conflict between the RSF and the Sudanese military.

clusters.title: What might change for streamers under the proposed $72B Netflix-Warner Brothers Discovery deal

items.title: What might change for streamers under the proposed $72B Netflix-Warner Brothers Discovery deal
How Netflix stole Warner Bros from David Ellison
items.standfirst: Old-guard Hollywood underestimated streaming pioneer that has upended the industry over two decades
items.content: Old-guard Hollywood underestimated streaming pioneer that has upended the industry over two decades

items.title: How the Netflix-Warner Bros. Deal Changes Hollywood
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. has agreed to purchase the streaming and studio assets of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. in a $72 billion deal that’s likely to impact the entertainment industry for decades.
items.content: Netflix Inc. has agreed to purchase the streaming and studio assets of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. in a $72 billion deal that’s likely to impact the entertainment industry for decades.

items.title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in $72 Billion Cash, Stock Deal | Bloomberg Tech 12/5/2025
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery after it completes the planned spinoff of its cable channels. Plus, the European Union Ambassador to the US responds to criticism of the $140 million fine the bloc has levied on Elon Musk’s social media platform X. And HPE CEO, Antonio Neri, discusses the company’s outlook after reporting disappointing 4Q AI server sales. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery after it completes the planned spinoff of its cable channels. Plus, the European Union Ambassador to the US responds to criticism of the $140 million fine the bloc has levied on Elon Musk’s social media platform X. And HPE CEO, Antonio Neri, discusses the company’s outlook after reporting disappointing 4Q AI server sales. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: HPE’s AI Servers Ready as Soon Data Centers Are, Says CEO
items.standfirst: HPE CEO Antonio Neri discusses the company’s earnings as its sales for AI servers fall short. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech”. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: HPE CEO Antonio Neri discusses the company’s earnings as its sales for AI servers fall short. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech”. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix, Warner Bros. Face Road to Finalizing Deal
items.standfirst: Finalizing the deal between Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery will be a longer and bigger fight than Game of Thrones, says Jon Klein, co-founder of Hang Media. The former head of CNN discusses the challenges facing the tie-up and the competition Netflix faces from YouTube and the creator economy. He speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Finalizing the deal between Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery will be a longer and bigger fight than Game of Thrones, says Jon Klein, co-founder of Hang Media. The former head of CNN discusses the challenges facing the tie-up and the competition Netflix faces from YouTube and the creator economy. He speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix Breaks From ‘Build, Not Buy’ With Warner Bros. Deal
items.standfirst: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a historic $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw discusses the combination of the world’s dominant paid streaming service with one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a historic $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw discusses the combination of the world’s dominant paid streaming service with one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix–Warner Bros. Deal Sets Up $72 Billion Antitrust Test
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. has won the heated takeover battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. Now it must convince global antitrust regulators that the deal won’t give it an illegal advantage in the streaming market.
items.content: Netflix Inc. has won the heated takeover battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. Now it must convince global antitrust regulators that the deal won’t give it an illegal advantage in the streaming market.

items.title: EU Can Regulate Tech, Bloc's US Ambassador Says
items.standfirst: European Union Ambassador to the US Jovita Neliupšienė talks about why bloc fined Elon Musk's X social network €120 million ($140 million) for violating a content-moderation law. She says the European Commission doesn’t target any one country or company with its rules. She discusses the EU’s approach to tech, defense, and the use of frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine's war effort. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: European Union Ambassador to the US Jovita Neliupšienė talks about why bloc fined Elon Musk's X social network €120 million ($140 million) for violating a content-moderation law. She says the European Commission doesn’t target any one country or company with its rules. She discusses the EU’s approach to tech, defense, and the use of frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine's war effort. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in Historic $72 Billion Deal
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., marking a seismic shift in the entertainment business as a Silicon Valley-bred streaming giant tries to swallow one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios.
items.content: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., marking a seismic shift in the entertainment business as a Silicon Valley-bred streaming giant tries to swallow one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios.

ai_summary: Netflix agreed to purchase the streaming and studio assets of Warner Bros. Discovery.
The deal is valued at $72 billion and is expected to impact the entertainment industry.
The deal marks a shift for Netflix, moving away from its "build, not buy" strategy.
Finalizing the deal will be a complex process, facing challenges and competition.
The deal will likely reshape the landscape of streaming and content creation.

items.title: Protesters smear food on the case of the U.K. Crown Jewels
items.standfirst: Video shows protesters smearing food on the case of the U.K. Crown Jewels in the Tower of London. The Jewel House was closed for an investigation and four people were later taken into custody.
items.content: Video shows protesters smearing food on the case of the U.K. Crown Jewels in the Tower of London. The Jewel House was closed for an investigation and four people were later taken into custody.

items.title: Tower of London reopens after apple crumble thrown at crown jewels display
items.standfirst: Four people arrested after civil-resistance group Take Back Power protest against inequality in the UKPart of the Tower of London was temporarily closed to visitors on Saturday after food was thrown at a display case containing the crown jewels in a protest against inequality in the UK.Four people were arrested after the action, which was claimed by Take Back Power – a self-described, non-violent civil-resistance group. It said custard and apple crumble was flung at the case, which contained the imperial state crown. Continue reading...

items.content: LONDON — The Tower of London was closed after a video appeared to show activists smearing food on a display case containing one of Britain’s crown jewels

Four people were arrested following the protest action.
The group Take Back Power claimed responsibility for the protest.
The protesters used custard and apple crumble in their demonstration.

The European Commission issued its decision following an…

The European Commission issued its decision following an…

What Happened: The European Commission accusing X of violating transparency rules under the EU’s Digital Services Act. The Commission took issue with X’s blue checkmark…

"The 'EU' imposed this crazy fine not just on [X], but also on me personally, which is even more insane!" the…

"The 'EU' imposed this crazy fine not just on [X], but also on me personally, which is even more insane!" the…

items.title: E.U. hits Musk's X with $140 million fine, says it broke hate speech and misinformation rules
items.standfirst: The European Commission has fined Elon Musk’s social media app X with the equivalent of $140 million, saying that it had breaching bloc’s digital rulebook.
items.content: The European Commission has fined Elon Musk’s social media app X with the equivalent of $140 million, saying that it had breaching bloc’s digital rulebook.

items.title: Elon Musk’s X fined €120m by EU in first clash under new digital laws
items.standfirst: Ruling likely to put European Commission on collision course with billionaire, and possibly Donald TrumpBusiness live – latest updatesElon Musk’s social media platform, X, has been fined €120m (£105m) after it was found in breach of new EU digital laws, in a ruling likely to put the European Commission on a collision course with the US billionaire and potentially Donald Trump.The breaches, under consideration for two years, included what the EU said was a “deceptive” blue tick verification badge given to users and the lack of transparency of the platform’s advertising. Continue reading...
items.content: Ruling likely to put European Commission on collision course with billionaire, and possibly Donald TrumpBusiness live – latest updatesElon Musk’s social media platform, X, has been fined €120m (£105m) after it was found in breach of new EU digital laws, in a ruling likely to put the European Commission on a collision course with the US billionaire and potentially Donald Trump.The breaches, under consideration for two years, included what the EU said was a “deceptive” blue tick verification badge given to users and the lack of transparency of the platform’s advertising. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The European Union fined Elon Musk's X $140 million for violating digital regulations.
The fine was issued for breaches of the EU's Digital Services Act.
Elon Musk warned of a "response" against those responsible for the penalty.
The EU accused X of violating transparency rules regarding hate speech and misinformation.
The ruling is likely to create tension between the EU and Elon Musk.

clusters.title: US Supreme Court to decide legality of Trump's order to limit birthright citizenship
clusters.neutral_headline: Supreme Court to Decide on Trump's Birthright Citizenship Order

items.title: US Supreme Court to decide legality of Trump's order to limit birthright citizenship
items.standfirst: The Supreme Court agreed on Friday to decide the legality of President Donald Trump's directive to restrict birthright citizenship in the United States, a contentious part of his efforts to curb immigration and a step that would alter how a 19th century constitutional provision has long been understood. Story by Shirli Sitbon.
items.content: The Supreme Court agreed on Friday to decide the legality of President Donald Trump's directive to restrict birthright citizenship in the United States, a contentious part of his efforts to curb immigration and a step that would alter how a 19th century constitutional provision has long been understood. Story by Shirli Sitbon.

items.title: Supreme Court to rule on Trump’s effort to end birthright citizenship
items.standfirst: Justices will weigh interpretation of US Constitution’s guarantees to ‘all persons’ born in the country
items.content: Justices will weigh interpretation of US Constitution’s guarantees to ‘all persons’ born in the country

items.title: US Supreme Court agrees to hear case challenging birthright citizenship
items.standfirst: Donald Trump's controversial executive order to end birthright citizenship had been rejected by lower courts.
items.content: Donald Trump's controversial executive order to end birthright citizenship had been rejected by lower courts.

ai_summary: The Supreme Court will decide on the legality of Trump's birthright citizenship order.
The order aimed to restrict birthright citizenship in the United States.
The case involves the interpretation of the 14th Amendment of the Constitution.
Lower courts had previously rejected Trump's executive order.
The Supreme Court will weigh the interpretation of "all persons" born in the country.

clusters.title: National guard member wounded in DC attack is ‘slowly healing’, says West Virginia governor
clusters.neutral_headline: National Guard Member Wounded in DC Attack

items.title: National guard member wounded in DC attack is ‘slowly healing’, says West Virginia governor
items.standfirst: Andrew Wolfe was shot in the head on 26 November, while Sarah Beckstrom died from her injuriesThe West Virginia national guard soldier who was wounded in the 26 November shooting that killed a colleague of his in Washington DC is “slowly healing”, according to West Virginia’s governor.Andrew Wolfe, 24, was shot alongside fellow West Virginia national guard soldier Sarah Beckstrom, 20, while they patrolled the US capital as part of the Trump administration’s push to deploy military members on to the city’s streets. Beckstrom died of her injuries the day after she was shot while Wolfe was hospitalized in critical condition. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Trump praises new childhood vaccine recommendations after panel votes to drop Hepatitis B shot
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Applauds Vaccine Recommendation Changes

items.title: Trump praises new childhood vaccine recommendations after panel votes to drop Hepatitis B shot
items.standfirst: A panel of vaccine advisors approved by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., voted to drop the Hepatitis B shot from newborn vaccine schedules on Friday. President Trump applauded the move on social media, but many medical experts and organizations, including the American Academy of Pediatrics, oppose the change.
items.content: A panel of vaccine advisors approved by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., voted to drop the Hepatitis B shot from newborn vaccine schedules on Friday. President Trump applauded the move on social media, but many medical experts and organizations, including the American Academy of Pediatrics, oppose the change.

items.title: Playwright Jeremy O Harris arrested in Japan for alleged drug smuggling
items.standfirst: The writer of the Tony award-nominated Slave Play remains in custody after authorities say they found MDMA in his bagAmerican actor and playwright Jeremy O Harris, known for the Tony-nominated Slave Play, was arrested last month at an airport in Japan on suspicion of attempting to smuggle illegal drugs into the country, local authorities said late on Thursday.Harris, 36, was stopped on 16 November at Naha airport on Okinawa island after a customs officer discovered 0.78 grams of crystal containing the synthetic drug MDMA in his tote bag, an Okinawa regional customs spokesperson said. Continue reading...
items.content: The writer of the Tony award-nominated Slave Play remains in custody after authorities say they found MDMA in his bagAmerican actor and playwright Jeremy O Harris, known for the Tony-nominated Slave Play, was arrested last month at an airport in Japan on suspicion of attempting to smuggle illegal drugs into the country, local authorities said late on Thursday.Harris, 36, was stopped on 16 November at Naha airport on Okinawa island after a customs officer discovered 0.78 grams of crystal containing the synthetic drug MDMA in his tote bag, an Okinawa regional customs spokesperson said. Continue reading...

items.title: Border clash between Afghanistan and Pakistan kills four civilians
items.standfirst: Clashes erupted late Friday in a tense border region between Pakistan and Afghanistan, with each side accusing the other of launching "unprovoked" attacks. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Lahore, Hamza Salam.

items.standfirst: Six days after alleged incident, evidence emerges without requiring medical intervention, New Zealand police sayPolice say they have recovered a Fabergé egg pendant from a man accused of swallowing the item in a jewellery story.New Zealand police have spent six days monitoring every bowel movement of the suspect, a spokesperson said, and the NZ$33,000 ($19,000) James Bond Octopussy pendant was recovered from his gastrointestinal tract on Thursday night by natural means, without requiring medical intervention.
